title: What does the truck brand GMC stand for? - Quora

response.answer_text: General Motors was founded as a holding company for the Buick brand in 1908. From Wikipedia: In 1909, GM purchased the Rapid Motor Vehicle Company of Pontiac, Michigan, forming the basis of the General Motors Truck Company, from which the "GMC Truck" brand name was derived. The GMC brand and logo appeared in 1911, here’s the original version.  And here’s a great overview on the early history of GMC trucks.
The letters GMC stand for General Motors Truck Company.
